title: CSS in Depth
author: Keith J. Grant
description: CSS in Depth by Keith J. Grant is a comprehensive guide for web developers who want to go beyond the basics of CSS and master the intricacies of styling web pages.
summary: CSS in Depth starts by reviewing the basic principles of CSS, then quickly moves on to more advanced concepts...

title: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites
author: Jon Duckett
description: Whether you’re a complete beginner or someone looking to brush up on HTML and CSS, this book provides a solid foundation and practical skills.
summary: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites starts with an introduction to HTML, covering the basic building blocks of a webpage...

title: System Design Interview
author: Alex Xu
description: System Design Interview: An Insider's Guide by Alex Xu is a must-read for software engineers and professionals preparing for system design interviews.
summary: System Design Interview: An Insider's Guide begins by introducing the key concepts of system design...

title: Computer Science Distilled
author: Wladston Ferreira Filho
description: Computer Science Distilled by Wladston Ferreira Filho is a concise and approachable introduction to the core concepts of computer science.
summary: Computer Science Distilled begins by explaining the art of problem-solving in computing...

title: The Art of Assembly Language
author: Randall Hyde
description: The Art of Assembly Language by Randall Hyde is a comprehensive and engaging introduction to assembly language programming.
summary: The Art of Assembly Language introduces readers to the fundamentals of assembly programming...

title: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach
author: Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig
description: The leading textbook in artificial intelligence, used in over 1,500 universities worldwide.
summary: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to the theory and practice of artificial intelligence. It covers topics such as problem-solving, knowledge representation, machine learning, and natural language processing.

title: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow
author: Aurélien Géron
description: A practical guide to machine learning using Python and popular frameworks like Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow.
summary: This book teaches you how to build and deploy machine learning models using Python. It covers topics like supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning.

title: Python for Data Analysis
author: Wes McKinney
description: A comprehensive guide to data analysis using Python and the Pandas library.
summary: This book introduces data analysis techniques using Python, focusing on the Pandas library. It covers data cleaning, manipulation, visualization, and more.

title: Deep Learning
author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville
description: The definitive textbook on deep learning, written by three pioneers in the field.
summary: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to deep learning, covering topics like neural networks, optimization, and generative models.

title: Data Science for Business
author: Foster Provost and Tom Fawcett
description: A guide to understanding data science concepts and applying them to real-world business problems.
summary: This book introduces data science concepts and techniques, focusing on their application in business contexts. It covers data mining, machine learning, and decision-making.

title: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
author: Christopher M. Bishop
description: A comprehensive introduction to pattern recognition and machine learning.
summary: This book covers the fundamentals of pattern recognition and machine learning, including Bayesian methods, neural networks, and support vector machines.

title: The Hundred-Page Machine Learning Book
author: Andriy Burkov
description: A concise and practical guide to machine learning.
summary: This book provides a concise yet comprehensive introduction to machine learning, covering key concepts and algorithms in just 100 pages.

title: Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques
author: Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, and Jian Pei
description: A comprehensive guide to data mining techniques and applications.
summary: This book covers the fundamental concepts and techniques of data mining, including data preprocessing, classification, clustering, and pattern discovery.

title: Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction
author: Richard S. Sutton and Andrew G. Barto
description: The definitive guide to reinforcement learning.
summary: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to reinforcement learning, covering topics like Markov decision processes, dynamic programming, and Monte Carlo methods.

title: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
author: Michael Sipser
description: A comprehensive introduction to the theory of computation.
summary: This book introduces the fundamental concepts of computation, including automata, computability, and complexity theory.
